intro: Stenoloma melleri, commonly known as the Meller's stenoloma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with showy, pale pink to white petals. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, typical of many plants in its family. Stenoloma melleri is often found in high-altitude ecosystems, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
